page.title: 04INDUSTRIAL GROWTH LEADENHAM
page.content: Len Houseman who runs the agricultural machinery buiness in Leadenham learned his trade in a village blacksmith's shop 40 years ago.He then worked a 50 hour week for 5/- a week and biked 6 miles to and from work.Now he says he works a 70 hour week but at least he lives next door.Coming to Leadenham 20 years ago,he worked alone for the first year.Now he employs 12 people and has extended the workshop behind the old smithy.Even this has been outgrown and a 6000sq ft extension is being built over the road.This will mean more jobs.Len's son who has worked there for 7 years will take over when Len retires.Local labour is used and local craftsmen are building the extension.All types of Agric. machinery are made,harrows,cultivators steerage hoes etc.Many are made for a St. Neots and Grantham firm.
